questions.question: 1.  A common type of mutant which cannot synthesize an essential metabolite that wild-type cells produce is termed as:
2. Type of mutation in which a change in code leads to substitution of a different amino acid is called a ............
3. Visual identification of auxotrophic mutants can be performed by:
4. An example of selective mutation from the group is

answers.a: a mutant of Bacillus subtilis unable to form endospores.
answers.b: a mutant of Escherichia coli unable to produce tryptophan
answers.c: a mutant of Streptococcus pneumoniae that does not form capsules.
answers.d: a mutant of E. coli that is resistant to streptomycin.
